2.labelNeg: Some user supplied inputs are vulnerable to SQL injection
2.labelPos: No user supplied inputs are vulnerable to SQL injection
2.name: SQL Injection
2.observNeg: Some user supplied inputs are inefficiently filtered and can be used to execute some SQL code.e
observNegHistory: Some user supplied inputs are inefficiently filtered and can be used to execute some SQL code.e
2.observPos: User inputs are well filtered before being included into SQL requests.
observPosHistory: User inputs are well filtered before being included into SQL requests.
2.reco:
Never trust user supplied inputs, apply some filtering before using them into SQL queries.
Use SQL prepared statements instead of regular queries.
2.recoFR:
Never trust user supplied inputs, apply some filtering before using them into SQL queries.
Use SQL prepared statements instead of regular queries.
recoHistory:
Never trust user supplied inputs, apply some filtering before using them into SQL queries.
Use SQL prepared statements instead of regular queries.
2.risk:
SQL injection may be used by malicious peoples to read all the content of your database.
Depending on the database configuration and on the injected SQL query, SQL injections are often allowing database writing.
In some case SQL injection may also lead to server side code execution.
riskHistory:
SQL injection may be used by malicious peoples to read all the content of your database.
Depending on the database configuration and on the injected SQL query, SQL injections are often allowing database writing.
In some case SQL injection may also lead to server side code execution.

SQL injection may be used by malicious peoples to read all the content of your database.

3.labelNeg: Some user supplied inputs are vulnerable to Cross-Site-Scripting (XSS)
3.labelPos: No user supplied inputs are vulnerable to Cross-Site-Scripting (XSS)
3.name: XSS
3.observNeg: Some user supplied inputs are inefficiently filtered and can be used to inject some client-side executable code into web pages.
observNegHistory: Some user supplied inputs are inefficiently filtered and can be used to inject some client-side executable code into web pages.
Some user supplied inputs are inefficiently filtered and can be used to inject some client-side executable code into web pages.
3.observPos: User supplied inputs are well filtred before being included into web pages.
observPosHistory: User supplied inputs are well filtred before being included into web pages.
3.reco: Never trust user supplied inputs, apply some filtering before including them into web pages.
recoHistory: Never trust user supplied inputs, apply some filtering before including them into web pages.
3.risk: XSS may be used by malicious peoples to have some client-side code execution.\nThis code execution can be used for example to steal user's session, to steal user's sensitives data or to perform some actions using his authorizations.
riskHistory: XSS may be used by malicious peoples to have some client-side code execution.\nThis code execution can be used for example to steal user's session, to steal user's sensitives data or to perform some actions using his authorizations.

4.name: Buffer Overflow
4.observNeg: I see that's a bad idea
4.observPos: I see that's a good idea
4.reco: I recommend you to see the risk.
